page.title: 14Hops Harvesting.
page.content: The fields in which hops are cultivated are called hop-gardens. They are grown up ropes on to a wire support and hop training is still a job that has to be done by hand, encouraging the young shoots to climb the ropes. At harvest time the vines are cut down from the top. This used to be done by men on stilts but they use a motorised lift. The old method of harvesting was all by hand so many extra labourers were needed. This provided a working annual holiday for families otherwise unable to afford such luxury. With the development of hop picking machines the few helpers now needed are mostly university students earning holiday money.
